page.title: 11FARMING AT MOOR FARM
page.content: My name is Sam. I live at Moor Farm. The farm is rented and is one hundred and thirty five acres. Ley, barley, mangles, cabbages, turnips, kale and rye are grown on our farm. But we are mainly a dairy farm. There are fifty milking cows, twelve beef cows, three stock bulls and twelve young bulls for beef. We also have twenty calf heifers, twenty yearling heifers, and twenty young calf heifers under one year. The main breed are red and white fresians, and charollais beef cows. We employ two lads on the farm, one of which is part time. Machines are used to help with the jobs like tractors, ploughs, muck spreaders, chain saws, corn drill and a hay bob.
